ygData.subject: Re: [gladiator] OT:Moderator Thoughts
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I think if you mess around with enough settings, you can pass on leadership. I think you need to make someone a moderator then remove your leadership

On Mon, 16 Sep 2002, Daniel Paul Hightower wrote:

> Yahoo Groups service has been . . . lacking for several months.
> Additionally, if something should happen to me or I no longer have
> the time to moderate this, there is no way to appoint a new moderator
> in the absence of the group owner.

I think if you mess around with enough settings, you can pass on
leadership. I think you need to make someone a moderator then remove your
leadership privilages or something. But I guess that's only if the owner
is present, so yeah...

>
> All of this has lead me to reluctantly consider the possibility of
> moving the group.

If you want, a mailing list could be set up at sourceforge. It'd also
benefit from people just finding out about Gladiator and joining it (I do
have a link to this group from the front page, but not many people go to
the front page). An tracker item can also be added where people would be
able to upload maps and stuff, so the files section won't be lost.

> Also on the short term, reluctantly I am considering shutting down
> public access to message archives to keep spammers from harvesting
> email addresses from our messages.

That's one thing the sourceforge mailing lists can't do.


- Zardus
